pZL1LN4bwNvtu_VZT9c_KA.text: Truly a gem. Their kebabs are great, amazing bread and the *best* abgoosht on Earth, Truly remarkable. The only time it let us down was on Persian New Year - they had a special menu which was so-so, but their regular menu is *great*.

BreQ4YeREi9_d35yNmeBNw.text: This restaurant is one of a gaggle of well-priced, bring-your-own-booze West London Persian restaurants. While its inexpensive but tasty fare is relatively similar to Alounak, a similar restaurant across the park in Bayswater, it is much more homely in atmosphere. The family-run place has some of the friendliest staff and amazingly succulent lamb skewers, and a meal there will rarely set you back more than 15 pounds. Definitely worth a try of you are local to Kensington or Earls Court. Then, you'll go again.

gDCi17JKkhozx9aUKpjl8Q.text: Simply fantastic!! Nina  your description is spot on! Can't get enough of this place!

QuJFnWFuP121ElslqIAQOA.text: absolutely the best iranian restaurant i have been to, and that includes those in iran. we cherish our visits to london for the chance to visit Mohsen's. Agha Mohsen va Rokni khanum, daste shoma dard nakhune!!!

FgQa8ZytFou5xq3EdtBOzQ.text: A must visit place if you are London. This is a comfortable authentic place to eat, so if you are looking for fancy its not your thing. But if you want first rate food do not hesitate. Some of the best Persian food we have eaten (including home made food). The selection is very nice, and there are range of dishes. Don't worry if you are not familiar with the cuisine, it has very subtle and wonderful flavors and a large variety to choose from. Do not forget to try the appetizers.Beware they do not credit card, come prepared with cash. And it is in a location that may seem incorrect, but very visible once you get there.

4kIK4wcNcnwgtKfvA9sqMg.text: My favorite restaurant in London. The chicken skewer and the lamb stew (with red beans, lemon, and herbs) were excellent! The service was warm and welcoming.  Highly recommended.

SZdQsq7gVmKoUbhEid6Srw.text: Mohsen was recommended to me by an Iranian friend.  What an excellent recommendation!My boyfriend and I tried it last Friday after going to the rugby.  The menu is pretty compact: a few starters, a list of grills and a daily special.  I cannot pretend to know much about Persian cuisine or what the Farci names for the dishes we ordered were but what we did order was delicious -- every single, generously portioned dish.Starters: feta cheese and mixed herbs, aubergine and walnut dip (this was especially good), yoghurt with cucumber (like tsatziki) and freshly made flatbread.Main: we shared a mixed grill which consisted of skewers of tender grilled chicken, lamb chops, minced lamb and grilled tomatoes, served with basmati rice topped with fragrant saffron rice.  The meat was grilled to perfection and the rice beautifully fluffy.  Don't forget to use the flatbread to mop up the 'jus' from the grilled meats!The service is surly (although I am convinced that beneath that brusque facade the 'mama' of the house has a heart of gold) but this is no fine-dining experience.  The interior is simple and rustic (proper rustice, not 'designer' rustic!)  One goes for excepetional food.  In and out... With leftovers kindly doggy-bagged for lunch the next day.  I am fortunate to live very close by so this will definitely be a staple dining venue going forward.

C2UNJ2WJPW3hAmtYxPpAlA.text: Outstanding Persian Food by Delightful FamilyI come from a Persian family with a long tradition of discriminating taste when it comes to authentic Persian food. It was dinner time when we were exploring Kensington. Looking online for a place with GOOD FOOD brought us to this little family run restaurant. As I always do with Persian food, I came to the restaurant a bit uncertain about all the accolades by the reviewers.  But the restaurant lived up to its reputation and then some.Starting with Tahdig (rice crust) drenched with yummy Ghormeh Sabzi (aromatic mixed herb stew), I followed with their special lamb dish consisting of a skewer of tender, marinated lamb fillet kabobs and a skewer of minced lamb kabob over aromatic basmati rice. I washed down the delicious food with their homemade, thick and sharp Dough (yogurt drink, which requires an acquired taste) and finished with two cups of fresh brewed Persian tea. A perfectly satisfying authentic Persian dinner!  My partner opted for the Soltani kabob, which  includes a flattened version of the lamb chunks, equally tender and tasty. Despite the excellent food, the intimate atmosphere, and the fantastic fresh flat bread, we were most enchanted by the delightful family that runs the restaurant.  Most of all, we loved the gregarious and ever cheerful mom who clearly is the matriarch in charge.We will definitely come back again and will recommend Mohsen Restaurant to everyone we know.

lvIRqFcDD8UAQa_st3vB3A.text: I've been here a few times and the food is solid and fairly priced. I recommend this place if you fancy a delicious persian meal.

z0PwNAjvSnK1HGlPTa3iHw.text: If you are Iranian this is probably a good place. Being from the states, the anti American conversation left me flat. One of the specialties was not available and the suggested replacement was awful.

op_nNeXnzkeQxLSX02Pbcg.text: As far as Persian restaurants go - this one is 5-star worthy!!  They have the BEST Joojeh. Everything we had was great. Lean on the pocketbook- 44 pounds for a meal for three. Truly a gem!

iw7yThNgSskNZqxy7jYoKQ.text: First time trying Persian/Iranian food and it was amazing.  Fresh naan made on the spot.  Appetizers portion is quite small but delicious nonetheless.  Overall, great ambiance, food and service.  Cash only.

Q9qElwKxpJfr-yG2QUvqYA.text: Admittedly, I'm not that well versed in Persian food. I've only had it three or four times, and my adventure here (with many colleagues) broadened my horizons. You can have lamb a lot of different ways. There is bread made fresh in an oven in the front of the restaurant, which is amazing and tastes even better. There was different arrangements of humus and chutney and other spices which I hadn't had before, which were also very tasty. A must for anyone wanting to try new things, or visit what they consider old classics.

eq4cwq0cUc81GQBxln4i5Q.text: Good clean home made style Persian food. Family run and very cozy. You can't go wrong.

-pCjhEkvUxFQ_5wBWjp1YA.text: Fantastic Chelo koobideh. I couldnt wait to get to Los Angeles to get koobideh from my favorite spot, so when we came across this dining spot on our last day in London, we had to jump on it. Tiny spot, but well worth the discomfort. Truly a gem, and didnt hurt the pocket book. Well worth a try if you are craving Persian food when in London.

a4Orj2PRBWyPrf-GOwhkrw.text: this is the best iranian restaurant ive ever eaten at. the location in kensington is a little far away from both main tube stations but it's worth it for sure. the bread smell from the tanoor at the front of the restaurant is lovely, and seeing them make the bread is great, adds a real authenticity to it. the starters are all really nice and the service is good. the place itself is small, almost like a cafe type place but there is an outside bit thats lush and green and looks really nice. but when the food is so good it really doesnt matter about the decor so much. i always go for the kabob barg which is just so well seasoned and cooked. the rice is delicious too and it comes with a tomato (which i dont eat so i give to my mum!) the bread is great and yogurt dips are good too. the rice is cooked just perfectly and the portions are really big. for the price, it's great. just the best place if you want authentic iranian food that wont break the budget but will make you feel like you're in iran!

h39JR6IMr59OwcLi1dcdpA.text: Unfortunately horrible service marred an otherwise decent food experience. I confirmed the price over the phone twice, and there was absolutely no mention of any delivery charge. When it reached however, they tried charging 20 GBP on top of the food cost. I ended up paying close to 40 GBP for a meal for one.Worst part was that when I was arguing with the owner about this over the phone, he yelled to send the food back. What incredibly poor service quality.I don't want my experience to taint others' decisions to eat here, because it may have been a one-off. However, still wouldn't recommend this over other much better options like Sheraz in Southwest London.

tD34rrNB4epJKVAhhVwxrA.text: I like the 5-star rating on Yelp - 'as good as it gets' is definitely appropriate for this restaurant since as far as Persian restaurants go, there is no better way to describe Mohsen. It's also one of the most affordable Persian restaurants in London, and therefore represents excellent value. A meal for two, with three starters, two mains, bread and a large bottle of sparkling water came to 42 pounds earlier tonight.I have been coming here for years and tried several other Persian restaurants in London. The rule with Persian cuisine seems to be that most reach a fairly good standard, but only one or two go beyond this level. Mohsen definitely fits the bill, and is the first place I take friends who want to try Persian cuisine.The starters are admittedly not first class, but tasty nonetheless (try the olivieh or kashkeh bademjan, my favorites) and go very well with the traditional, freshly prepared bread served here. As for the mains, stick to the Chelo Kebab, and go for either the koubideh (minced lamb), barg (strips of lamb fillet) or 'joojeh' without bones (chicken). The decor and atmosphere is very homely, so don't go here expecting a very chic experience. It's quite like eating in Mrs and Mr. Mohsen's living room, which adds to the familiar and warm feel of the place.

CWabf7yPVKtsv-V3r-aDCA.text: We came across Mohsen's attempting to find the halfway point between my place and my friend's in Richmond. We settled on Earl's Court and I was given the job of finding an affordable, but delicious place to meet. On entrance to Mohsen, one is greeted with the sweet smell of fresh dough being rolled out in a corner. With the feel of a home run establishment, the service was terrific, as our waiter helped us choose which dishes would satisfy the group. We shared mezze and some main courses while d rinking the wine recommendations of my friend's French boyfriend--picked up at the supermarket down the street as the restaurant is bring your own.  Would definitely come again, if only for the bread and starters!

0q4Zenr3WLkcP6D1KQijvg.text: Standing opposite a lonely homebase store on a busy one way cut through from A4 to A40, Mohsen is an unlikely spot for a decent meal, but it is wonderful. Service is friendly, attentive but not intrusive. The meat is always very tender and juicy, the rice is delicious, and starters are also yummy. Portions are good, and prices low.

7tlFT0rSh7Lk-Cj86XuO1g.text: I used to travel to London and its the best cozy Persian restaurant in London. Managed by kind and professional family. I miss you guys and hope see you soon.

0Wrvm6enMAPQttTYWolaxA.text: Unfortunately horrible service marred an otherwise decent food experience. I confirmed the price over the phone twice, and there was absolutely no mention of any delivery charge. When it reached however, they tried charging 20 GBP on top of the food cost. I ended up paying close to 40 GBP for a meal for one. Worst part was that when I was arguing with the owner about this over the phone, he yelled to send the food back. What incredibly poor service quality. I don't want my experience to taint others' decisions to eat here, because it may have been a one-off. However, still wouldn't recommend this over other much better options like Sheraz in Southwest London.

Mwqwm9S6oHaNFKL_AZ6DqA.text: This Kebab house offer more than Kebab, rice and lamb stew are among the variety they serve in this restaurant. The welcoming feel of this restaurant is second to none. The traditional décor is not overtly done, and it has a touch of contemporary design. This Iranian/Persian restaurant is among many close restaurants close to Kensington Olympia tube station and off the high road, but it stands out because of the service provided and the friendliness of the staff.

aWVkebVTZ4J_yLb_Imufow.text: Fabulous food. Friendly service. Great value. Remember, it's BYOB but there's a Tesco close by or, at worst, you can buy wine / beerfrom the pub next door.

GcK9q9hbb55DiZjCR3A-vw.text: I so wish I had found this place years ago. Had the hummus and olives and it was some of the best I've had. Then had chicken boneless and lamb koobideh. It was cooked just right juicy tasteful awesome!! YouMust go !

lTjkJpZsT-E_JHdANqusVg.text: One of the best food I had in London.Very clean, tasty, extremely friendly staff.. can't deny my happiness in this place

cyk7NcejoW2aCS9wqw-byQ.text: Took the hike to this amazing restaurant, and so glad we did!! The staff was in bright spirits and incredibly helpful, I got to watch the naan man make my bread right in front of me fresh from the awesome tandoori oven they have sitting in front of the restaurant, the back room is colorful and beautifully lit, i assume for big parties/families as is Persian custom! I rarely eat meat but the saffron chicken and lamb kebab was so moist and tasty! The panir sabzi was super fresh! Can't wait to come back!

EXYSm3c6IPhD67h-S7Hgww.text: So glad I found a delicious Persian restaurant in London! The place is relatively small (from an American perspective), but they are very big on service and flavor. It seems like a lot of locals/regulars go there since the serves knew almost everyone by name. The chicken kabob and koobideh were delicious and you obviously need to get the mast moosir with it. Love that they bake fresh bread!Ps. They sell doogh and if you haven't tried it already, you need to!

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Mast moosir, fresh bread, and doogh!

auiAPHtTrOijL8-gYVeNpg.text: Wonderful people. Wonderful kabob. As an Iranian visiting London stumbled on this gem and what a fine!!! Delicious!

LWDDzIBv_iGEPUzgKZSscQ.text: I was surprised by how much I loved their food. I had chicken skewers and naan with sauce. Yummy!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Very cozy place too!
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. I had the chicken skewers with a side of naan! I was surprised how much I loved it!

NysJNxDBFqUOu5Gi_tvdWQ.text: This is a great restaurant. I'm a fan.A beautiful selection of kebabs, bread and dip.The Naan bread is thin and sesame seed coated. Perfect with the shallot blended dip.Kebabs are cooked fresh and served with a grilled tomato and either rice or bread. The rice is beautiful - not dry at all. I have tried the minced lamb and diced lamb kebabs - for my tastes the minced one is better - but only down to preference. It's not spicy, just perfectly cooked.Staff were friendly on my visit - a very broad customer range - really nice to see. I was served quickly and the lady waiting on me was very attentive.I had bread, dip, double skewers of meat, rice and tomato. With a coke and water - all came to £21 - I couldn't finish it. Portions are generous.Will happily return.

Eh1GRFOvwqf3_WdI7fG4KQ.text: If I didn't live on the other side of London, I would eat here all the time. I make time for this place b/c it's worth it. Truly the best chicken I've ever eaten. Super moist and flavorFULL. I recommend this place to anyone that is in west London. The bread that they make in the front of the restaurant is so good. The variety of spreads are amazing. So good to eat with the breads and the meats. Portions are great. I recommend ordering the combo and sharing with someone else and also ordering the spreads. You'll get the best of all the flavors and dishes. I love that the food doesn't feel oily or heavy. Tastes fresh and homemade. Cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Chicken with salad (sub rice)
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Humus
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Aubergine

-TFljsKSC42_D4olJSqwzA.text: Dropped in for late tea on Friday night, while staying at nearby hotel. Just asked hostess to give me whatever food she recommended. It was just wonderful. Atmosphere is unpretentious, friendly and genuine. Families couples and single diners all looked relaxed and well fed. Very reasonable prices and you can see why this place doesn't need to advertise. An amazing little place!

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Main course. Tea and a little dessert.
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom

KJ-0J53FqDekohe2mAvn2g.text: Bottom line: Extremely friendly owner and wide variety of foods. The starters were the best, but I have had better Persian entrees. Having said that, if I am in the neighborhood I will stop by again.The good: The salads we got as starters were REALLY GOOD.  The place is family friendly and the atmosphere islaid back and authenticThe bad: I wonder if I chose a wrong entree? Instead of going for a kabbab I chose a stew. I guess that is always a gamble. Others in the restaurant seemed to enjoy their food very much.

evwpAnfC3R2QkTSVLJwslQ.text: LOVED. Persian cucumber salad, bread, lamb skewers = YUM!!! wish there was one in islington too.  will def be back when i'm in the earl's court neighborhood.friendly staff!cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. The minced lamb skewer

ueZB6-kKEFWRfnHQZtyyeA.text: I didnt expect the service I get in US Persian restaurants, but it seems like the Persian restaurants take price gauging to a new level.  All the stuff you get for free in the US are charged in every restaurant I have visited in the UK: charges for bread, cheese and herbs, etc.  The portions are smaller, the food is reasonably well cooked, and the prices are acceptable. The restaurants are all fairly small including this one. The kicker is this:  I order water, they offer bottled water.  They bring a plastic water, already openes, and the water tastes just like tap water: and they charges somewhere between 4-6 Britsh Pounds for it!.

pPVVKl1CxNbYPWf4zq23qw.text: On a recent visit to London we tried this restaurant. Great ambiance, food handling and service. The food is absolutely amazing. Clearly use of absolutely freshest ingredients and cooked to perfection.

zDy7RARVsLNJVXCp1D5gSQ.text: Came here with my family. Great food, fantastic service, and a lovely owner. We had more than enough to eat for $108.

Yl6m8hsw4nSZjL8_Y76u8A.text: Amazing little find. I have had many a persian kebab but I find mohsen's are to a very high standard. Juicy and succulent, you can't go wrong with their kebab koubideh served with rice and fresh bread from the tanoor oven.

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Aash reshteh

KNHIEh2PBQ5Xw7-_I8ESkQ.text: Delicious Persian food! Our family loved the food and the ambiance. They were very friendly and accommodating for a group of seven. Highly recommended!

Q0XdumN4Wih8HGrnVGgZ9w.text: This was my first real meal in London. So happy with it. We came in late at night and the staff stayed open a bit later for us which was really nice. The food was so amazing!  Im drooling and getting sad wishing I was still near by. Everything from the lamb, chicken and rice were so flavorful it was so comforting. It seemed to be like a local spot too which was cool.

7slRiyABDOopjFLpdupvQQ.text: This is an incredible place!  I went here on a recent trip through the area and as other reviewers have said, it's easily one of the best, most reasonably priced, most authentic Iranian/Persian restaurants I've ever visited.  The decor is relatively unremarkable.  The service was attentive, yet not overbearing... and, my goodness, was the food ever excellent!  The spice levels were perfect, the meat was all very high quality, tender, and succulent, and the starters were outstanding.  Everything brought to our table was truly exceptional... all the way to the flatbread prepared and cooked in the front window for all to see.  To reinforce though, this place is ALL about the food.  Great for a meal with a friend or colleague, but probably not the place for a romantic first date.I was there with a colleague and for both of us, the bill was less than 40 GBP, and we left totally stuffed.  So good!  I will return!!

SwG0UktUFY-Qj79865MI2g.text: The place didn't set a great experience I was hopping to get from my first trip to London. I'm a vegetarian & I understand the place wasn't the best where I could find good choices, but what ruined the experience was the service attitude.

6MDgAe74zY8K9c6e8KLN5A.text: Went here for dinner tonight because of the excellent Yelp reviews and I'm happy to report that all the stars are well deserved. It is a small, family owned restaurant. Great service here and they make you feel welcome. The mom even came to our table to say hi and ask how our meals were. The food is more than fairly priced compared to all the other restaurants here in London. The Persian food served here is authentic and wonderful. It's like going to your Persian buddy's family dinner. They make fresh naan in the front of the restaurant to order and it is wonderful with the hummus. I had the bone in chicken and my husband ordered lamb stew. So delicious. Will definitely come back here again. Oh, remember to bring cash as they don't accept credit cards.

W57oK2MsswMc0lxOulTxJQ.text: Legit Persian perfection. Genuinely can't be faulted. Nice intimate atmosphere, great flavours, and those freshly made breads. OMGEEE

etM15L6TAX7wD0bH9OQNMA.text: After checking in to my hotel down the road I poped in based off the previous Yelp reviews.  The establishment is small like many other middle eastern joints but intimate and quiet.  The staff were very friendly and prompt with their service. The menu was fairly straightforward.  Most of their plates offer lamb as the protein but each offering had a different cut of lamb albeit marinated/cooked in a similar fashion. I ordered Hummus, Naan, and Chelo Chenjeh.  Hummus was as expected but the Naan came to me different than others I have ordered in the past.  It was made fresh in a tandoor oven near the restaurant entrance.  It was thinner and more crispy than other naan breads I have eaten. Don't get me wrong. It was delicious but just found it interesting how differently it was prepared.  Anyway, for those who might not know, Chelo is traditional Persian rice and is cooked almost as if it was pasta as opposed to the traditional method used around the world and is served with a small portion of saffron rice on top.  The Chenjeh is lamb filet.  Food was excellent. Lamb was cooked to perfection and paired very well with the Chelo.

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom

IZw5KcJyutHG28ZpzChdwA.text: Fun experience trying Persian food for the first time. Excellent service and large portions that we shared. No one left hungry.Authentic decor in a family run restaurant. We really liked the naan bread with dips. Also, the lamb was tender and juicy. I really liked the kebobs.

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom

rIpI9LL8x8aim0nkAOhlnQ.text: This is the best place to have Persian food in London! The koobideh kabob, Fesenjoon and Ghorme Sabzi were amazing! The dessert was incredibly delicious as well! Definitely worth it to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom

fGcQg8CcL0lItJ1FqQglYQ.text: Far superior to Persian food you find in the US even LA. Amazing kabab. Juicy and tasty. Tried Chenjeh and shishkabab. A+ for food and service

H-mJ5Tcp827vP2yGr1-pEg.text: Adorable restaurant, we were kindly greeted into the restaurant by the owner. We ordered a starter of their in house made to order bread with hummus and it was absolutely delicious.I ordered the chicken plate with rice and it was absolutely delicious. The amount of flavor packed in that chicken was incredible.  Once finished, we had some of their in house tea which is also fantastic post meal. We look forward to coming back here when we visit London in the future.

D7Dw7CCHi0gpnaj6VTmVMg.text: Amazing Persian food, defiantly can hang with Los Angles places, if not better!  Fresh bread made on sight old school style!  Mohammad makes the best bread OG style!

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom

x6Dxh5ZrkoIreCsq7oiiog.text: We found it on Yelp and decided to give a try. Long story short - we ate here 3 days in a row, enjoying same dish - Koobideh with Naan bread being baked on the spot. It is really fresh, really tasty - I wish I would stay in London one more day just to have it once more. Owner is really nice guy, we met his family. It's a family run business with great taste, great meat - worth a visit. Definitely recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom

XFfCwJIw9mKweh4smoCBRw.text: First time eating Persian food. The service was fantastic. The atmosphere was warm and inviting. The portions were huge! The naan and eggplant dip were delicious, and I don't typically like eggplant. The reason for four stars is that everything had a sour flavor (think limes), and I didn't prefer the flavor. I think that's a flavor preference, not an execution problem on the part of the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Dinner menu

IK_9igEVFt5wPor6HYlCSA.text: We decided to try this place thanks to all the reviews on yelp and they were spot on. The food was so tasty and the service was excellent! The portions are huge. We ordered too much food but we could not stop eating. Highly recommend it.

4OLhqczwOXvc3WuHQxwVwA.text: Average food nice ambiance mediocre service ! The koobideh( ground beef) Jujeh ( chicken) kabob was good !  The steak was average .  Only thing we weren't quite satisfied was our bill .  We felt they overcharged us!

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom

rP1a2YQ6YDk2zj4XPnnHFQ.text: We are from Los Angeles and were visiting London for a few days. We found Mohsen on Yelp and took quite a long taxi ride to get here. It was well worth the drive!The owners entertained us all night and were so accommodating and sweet. Their food was absolutely amazing and service was even better. I highly recommend this restaurant and will go back whenever I return to London!

jZvCVwq6KPnvxYiw9_tp5w.text: Very friendly atmosphere and reasonably priced. Hummus was excellent and sesame bread was a great compliment. Lamb skewers were tasty but the star for me was the saffron chicken. Some of the best I've ever had in a Persian restaurant. Will definitely return.

BEkmchIJmFSELQiaEWLmVA.text: It's very delicious food, home cooking style,  and quality.  Never the less, the lady in charged on the restaurant is very very friendly.I do recommend this place.

lf3jG0mPSLYOABwOt_6lsg.text: One of the best kababs I have ever had! The chicken melts in your mouth, the koonideh is really good and the rice is amazing! The tea is on a league of its own. I'm so happy they sell the mixture!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom

fIZfc-4EZjo4be03kMnjYA.text: Had a nice dinner here with friends on a recent trip to London.  Owner / operators were very cordial and accommodating with our groupWe ordered a wide selection of dips and naan to start, and they were all excellent.  Their grilled naan was perfectly crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside...a great "vehicle" to eat the tasty dips.The appetizers were followed by several main dishes...the best of which was the skewered grilled chicken served with rice.A fun night was had by all, but remember to bring CASH as they do not take credit cards.

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Restaurant exterior
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. More tasty dishes
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Selection of dips...yummy!

95yG4Hr8Ut84KcG3UDdPKg.text: We were saying in a nearby AirBnB and it was raining so we didn't want to walk far for dinner. Luckily Mohsen was a few minutes walk away from where we were staying. Not being familiar with Persian food we had no idea what to order. The owner's wife was extremely gracious and helpful in describing the various menu items and made suggestions to ensure we ordered a variety of dishes that would complement each other.We were very happy with the food which had flavours we hadn't tasted before. The quality of the food was good, the service was impeccable and the the overall experience was great. They don't have a website so it's difficult to research the menu etc. but I highly recommend a visit, you won't be disappointed.

zHMqvs7bJyn2lizdt8S-fA.text: This is my favourite Persian place in the entire world... yes the WORLD. I travel alot for work and have sampled the persian cuisine on many continents. (Disclaimer: never actually in the middle east but none the less). This is by far the best and it happens to be within walking distance of my house! Yay for me.The food is very fresh and the service is wonderful. I've sampled many of the offerings here, and it's hard to choose what I think is best. The chicken kabobs are soft, tender and juicy. The stews are flavourful yet not overbearing. The bread cooked fresh and plentiful. Basically you can't go wrong at this place.My only gripe about this place is that it is cash only, which I always seem to forget. FYI There is a cash point at the Tesco down the road on Cromwell so make sure to stop by there on the way. Whether I am down the road or across the globe, whenever I am craving Persian food this is the place that comes to mind.

j17uqOJRBG88jGKGr6U3ow.text: Small and cozy. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was my first time eating Iranian food and our server was happy to help us find the right dish. We got the sampler for two so we could try a bit of everything. Try the nahn and hummus. Made fresh and in house.

6UqZkqfTKuQe51Tz_5KzqA.text: I came here with a group of people for lunch. It's a small cafe that seats around 15-20 ppl. It's a family run business that really cares about their food. They make their own homemade naan in front of the store. The chicken was super moist, but the best thing on the menu was the baby lamb chops. They give you butter to add to the rice as well. Very comfortable atmosphere with kind owners. If you're in the area, definitely give this place a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Lamb chops- the best thing here!!!
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Tea and snacks after the meal to help digest
Photo of Mohsen - London, United Kingdom. Homemade naan in front of the store
